title: Ticket #2421: Create simple installation for current blahp over ssh
description:
Currently, setting up our blahp-over-ssh prototype is overly complicated. We want to make the setup process as easy as possible without major modifications to the code.

Current Plan

These are the steps the user would need to perform:
  • On the user's submit machine
    • Install Condor regularly with simple --bosco option
      • This can be done without root and without setting CONDOR_CONFIG in the environment
    • Start condor_master
  • For each PBS/LSF submit node
    • Run a setup tool that installs all required software on the remote machine

The following work would have to be done. We estimate this would take 1-2 days.

  • Define default locations for passphrase file and blahp installation
  • Modify REMOTE_HOSTS in remote_gahp to have a default option
  • Modify REMOTE_HOSTS to have a username field with default option
  • Add remote_gahp and bosco_add_host scripts to Condor
  • Add --bosco option to condor_install (.5 days) (UW)
    • Installs a personal Condor under ~/bosco
  • Write installation instructions
  • Add ~/.condor/condor_config to list of default config file locations (.5 days) (UW)
  • Change code to use separate ssh key for blahp authentication. (3 days) (UW)
    • Key is encrypted with passphrase stored elsewhere on disk.
  • Write bosco_add_host, which installs blahp on the remote server (2 days)
    • Modify blahp config file (which is a shell script) to determine proper values each time it's invoked
    • On first invocation, script generates ssh key for bosco
  • Improve blahp's handling of staging files vs using shared filesystem (.5 days) (UW or CG)
    • Assume shared filesystem
  • Improve blahp's handling of pbs skipping complete state for some jobs (UW or CG)
    • Check how cream and gram handle this (2 days)
    • Add check for pbs configuration that fixes this and print error (.5 days)
    • Discuss improving blahp with its developers (4 days)

Milestones

  • remote_gahp accepts options on command line DONE
  • remote_gahp uses separate ssh credential DONE
  • remote_gahp has default locations for files (ssh credential, batch_gahp) DONE
  • SGE support in Condor DONE
  • Add ~/.condor as default Condor config file location DONE
  • Support new blahp types without changes in Condor DONE
  • Change gridmanager to allow extra arguments to remote_gahp DONE
  • Usage scenario transcript DONE
  • Upgrade blahp external in Condor to latest version DONE
  • Improve blahp handling of completed state DONE
  • Write/modify local installation script DONE
  • Write remote installation script bosco_add_host DONE
    • send blahp to remote CE
  • Change blahp's pbs configuration to assume a shared filesystem DONE
  • Make real screen capture of BOSCO installation DONE

  • Test assembled package

Usage Scenario

Here's a proposed terminal session showing the installation of BOSCO. 

% /tmp/condor-7.7.4/condor_install --bosco
Installing Condor from /tmp/condor-7.7.4 to /home/jfrey/.condor

Condor has been installed into:
    /home/jfrey/.condor

Configured condor using these configuration files:
  global: /home/jfrey/.condor/condor_config
  local:  /home/jfrey/.condor/local.nostos/condor_config.local

In order for Condor to work properly you must add the Condor bin
and sbin directories (/home/jfrey/.condor/bin) to your PATH environment
variable. Created scripts which can be sourced by users to setup their
Condor environment variables.  These are:
   sh: /home/jfrey/.condor/condor.sh
  csh: /home/jfrey/.condor/condor.csh

Also, you must run /home/jfrey/.condor/sbin/condor_master
to start Condor.
% . ~/.condor/condor.sh
% condor_master
% bosco_add_host cluster.foo.edu
jfrey@cluster.foo.edu's password:
Installing BOSCO on cluster.foo.edu...
Installation complete
%

Here's a real terminal session showing the installation of BOSCO. 

% tar zxvf condor-7.7.5-UW_development-rhel5.7-stripped.tar.gz
% cd condor-7.7.5-UW_development-rhel5.7-stripped
% ./condor_install --bosco
Installing Condor from /scratch/jfrey/build.bosco/condor-7.7.5-UW_development-rhel5.7-stripped to /afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco

Condor has been installed into:
    /afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco

Configured condor using these configuration files:
  global: /afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco/etc/condor_config
  local:  /afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco/local.ferdinand/condor_config.local

In order for Condor to work properly you must set your CONDOR_CONFIG
environment variable to point to your Condor configuration file:
/afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco/etc/condor_config before running Condor
commands/daemons.
Created scripts which can be sourced by users to setup their
Condor environment variables.  These are:
   sh: /afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco/condor.sh
  csh: /afs/cs.wisc.edu/u/j/f/jfrey/bosco/condor.csh

% . ~/bosco/condor.sh
% condor_master
% bosco_add_host e016.chtc.wisc.edu
Enter password for bosco ssh key:
Enter password to copy ssh keys to e016.chtc.wisc.edu:
jfrey@e016.chtc.wisc.edu's password:
Installing BOSCO on e016.chtc.wisc.edu...
Installation complete
% emacs ~/bosco/local.ferdinand/condor_config.local
# Add GRIDMANAGER_MAX_SUBMITTED_JOBS_PER_RESOURCE=10
# This ensures that at most 10 jobs are sent to the batch system at a time.
% cat pbs.desc
universe = grid
grid_resource = pbs jfrey@e016.chtc.wisc.edu
executable = /home/jfrey/pbs-test/job.sh
output = /home/jfrey/pbs-test/job.output.$(Cluster).$(Process)
error = /home/jfrey/pbs-test/job.error.$(Cluster).$(Process)
transfer_executable = false
skip_filechecks = true
+remote_iwd="/home/jfrey/pbs-test"
notification = NEVER
queue 100
% condor_submit pbs.desc
Submitting job(s).....
100 job(s) submitted to cluster 1.
%

Here are some questions about the installation process:

  • Should we rely on having CONDOR_CONFIG set in the environment?
    • The user has to source ~/bosco/condor.sh to get the Condor bin and sbin directories in their PATH. This also sets CONDOR_CONFIG.
    • We have proposed adding ~/.condor/condor_config as a location to look for the Condor config file. The installer can make a symlink from there to ~/bosco/etc/condor_config.
  • Should the install script start condor_master for the user?
  • Do we want a mechanism to restart condor_master if it or the machine crashes?

Notes and Bugs

The BOSCO code currently lives on V7_7-bosco-publicbranch in the Condor git repository. To build the BOSCO release package, see BuildingBosco.

Details about the BOSCO command-line tools are available in #2811.

Historical

We originally had three proposals for what to do. They are arranged below in increasing amount of work required and simpler setup for the user. We decided on proposal 2, with modifications as the work progressed.

Option 1

These are the steps the user would need to perform:
  • On the user's submit machine
    • Install customized version of Condor and start condor_master
      • This will require installing as root or ensuring CONDOR_CONFIG is always set in their environment
    • Place ssh passphrase in the default file
  • On the PBS/LSF submit node
    • Untar blahp tarball in default location

The following work would have to be done. We estimate this would take 1-2 days.

  • Define default locations for passphrase file and blahp installation
  • Modify REMOTE_HOSTS in remote_gahp to have a default option
  • Modify REMOTE_HOSTS to have a username field with default option
  • Assemble slightly modified Condor tarball
    • Add remote_gahp script
    • Modify config parameters
  • Assemble blahp tarball and make publicly available
  • Write installation instructions

Option 2

These are the steps the user would need to perform:
  • On the user's submit machine
    • Install customized version of Condor and start condor_master
      • This can be done without root and without setting CONDOR_CONFIG in the environment
    • Place ssh passphrase in the default file
  • On the PBS/LSF submit node
    • Untar blahp tarball in default location

The following work would have to be done (in addition to the work for option 1).

  • Add ~/.condor/condor_config to list of default config file locations (.5 days) (UW)
  • Modify condor_install to use ~/.condor as the preferred installation location for personal Condors. (.5 days) (UW)
    • ~/.condor is LOCAL_DIR. RELEASE_DIR would be under ~/bosco/condor or some such.
  • Add installation script to blahp tarball to auto-configure blahp config file (2 days)
    • Or modify config file (which is a shell script) to determine proper values each time it's invoked
  • Improve blahp's handling of staging files vs using shared filesystem (.5 days) (UW or CG)
    • Assume shared filesystem
  • Improve blahp's handling of pbs skipping complete state for some jobs (UW or CG)
    • Check how cream and gram handle this (2 days)
    • Add check for pbs configuration that fixes this and print error (.5 days)
    • Discuss improving blahp with its developers (4 days)
  • Change code to use separate ssh key for blahp authentication. (3 days) (UW)
    • Key is encrypted with hard-coded passphrase.
    • Write setup script for user machine that generates Condor ssh key and modifies ssh trusted_keys on cluster node
  • Add installation script that includes smoke test job (3 days) (UW or CG)
    • Without the traceroute test
    • Consider having OSG service that's set up correctly

Option 3

These are the steps the user would need to perform:
  • On the user's submit machine
    • Run a condor_install script
    • Place ssh passphrase in the default file
  • On the PBS/LSF submit node
    • Nothing

The following work would have to be done (in addition to the work for options 1 and 2).

  • Write install script that downloads correct version of Condor, configures it as a personal Condor, and starts condor_master (3 days)
  • Strip down modified Condor tarball to remove unneeded files (.5 days)
    • Remove execute-side files
    • Remove central manager files
    • Remove shadows
    • Remove gahps
  • Modify remote_gahp to install blahp on remote machine if it's not installed already (2 days)
  • Have remote_gahp choose correct blahp to install via one of these options:
    • Use CDE (http://www.stanford.edu/~pgbovine/cde.html) to create a universal blahp installation (2 days)
    • Use a modified form of the install script mentioned above to select the correct blahp tarball (1 day)
